class.name: LayeredSoundResource
class.brief_description: A resource for holding configuration for layered vehicle sounds.
class.description: This resource defines how different sounds (starting, main loop, ending) are played and modulated based on parameters like speed or other vehicle states. It allows configuring sound mapping, pitch, volume, cross-fading, and other properties for complex sound setups.

method.name: get_next_sound
method.description: Retrieves the relative file path for the next sound from the [code]sound_table[/code] according to the currently played one.

method.name: get_previous_sound
method.description: Retrieves the relative file path for the previous sound from the [code]sound_table[/code] according to the currently played one.

method.name: get_sound_file_path
method.description: Retrieves the sound file path from the [code]sound_table[/code] associated with the given index [code]property_value[/code].

method.name: get_sound_next_pitch
method.description: Retrieves the relative pitch for the next sound from [code]pitch_table[/code] according to the currently played sounds.

method.name: get_sound_pitch
method.description: Retrieves the pitch value from the [code]pitch_table[/code] associated with the given index [code]property_value[/code].

method.name: get_sound_previous_pitch
method.description: Retrieves the relative pitch for the previous sound from [code]pitch_table[/code] according to the currently played sounds.

members.member: The factor by which the sound's amplitude (volume) is multiplied. A value of 1.0 means no change.
An offset added to the sound's amplitude (volume) after applying the [code]amplitude_factor[/code].
The duration in seconds for cross-fading between sounds when switching or modulating.
An array of file paths for sounds to be played when the sound sequence ends (e.g., engine shutting down).
If [code]true[/code], forces the preloading of associated sound files to potentially reduce latency at the cost of higher initial memory usage.
The factor by which the sound's frequency (pitch) is multiplied. A value of 1.0 means no change.
An offset added to the sound's frequency (pitch) after applying the [code]frequency_factor[/code].
An array of file paths for the main looping sounds (e.g., the engine running loop).
The positional offset of the sound source relative to the parent node (e.g., the [AudioStreamPlayer3D] using this resource).
A dictionary mapping indices or keys to pitch scale values for corresponding sounds in the [code]sound_table[/code]. Used for dynamic pitch adjustments based on state.
The amount of random variation applied to the pitch scale.
Nominal sound range, in meters. A value of -1 disables spatial positioning, making the sound the same in every point, equally in every channel.
A dictionary mapping indices or keys to sound file paths. Used for dynamically selecting sounds based on state.
An array of file paths for sounds to be played when the sound sequence starts (e.g., engine starting up).
